intro: Erechtites petiolatus, commonly known as the common beggar-ticks, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a herbaceous annual or biennial species characterized by its rough, hairy stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically visited by various pollinators. Its fruits are dry, three-lobed capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Erechtites petiolatus is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in certain regions.
